programmes.show_description: Perhaps better known for bigger hits - all of these tracks from famous acts surely deserve another outing! You'll not have heard most of these songs for ages!
A non-stop ticket to the ultimate retro rave! We crank up the neon and hit the dancefloor with the most electrifying feelgood music videos the 80s had to offer.
They seemed to arrive from nowhere, burst into the chart and caused a mini pop sensation. Bruno's back, taking you through the decade year by year, with his pick of 30 surprise hits!
You may remember the artists, but do you recall their lesser heard songs? With Kim Wilde, Cliff Richard, OMD, Duran Duran & Heaven 17.
You may remember the artists, but do you recall their lesser heard songs? With Adam Ant, Shalamar, Musical Youth, Rod Stewart & The Assembly.
You may remember the artists, but do you recall their lesser heard songs? With Tears Fears, Freddie Mercury & Level 42.
60 minutes of back to back number 1s. From The Lady In Red to West End Girls - it's The Final Countdown! With Mr Charts himself - Mark Goodier.
Dramatic storylines, big dance routines, neon lights and iconic fashions - these are the classic music videos that made 1986!
A complete rundown of the 30 biggest selling UK singles for 1986 - can you believe these were all hits 40 years ago? And if you thought Madonna was at number 1 - think again!
Dramatic storylines, big dance routines, neon lights and iconic fashions - these are the classic music videos that made 1986!

programmes.show_name: Jenny Powell: Such A Good Feeling!
programmes.show_description: Dancing through history - one anthem at a time! From late 80s optimism to mid 90s euphoria, it's where house, rave and eurodance all started. Hands in the air people!
You may remember the artists, but do you recall their lesser heard songs? With Janet Jackson, Neneh Cherry, Lightning Seeds & De La Soul.
Sixty minutes of back to back UK chart runners-up from 1989, a year dominated by dance and Jason Donovan! With Mr Charts himself, Mark Goodier.
Hits and headlines from the year Daniel Radcliffe and Taylor Swift were born, Jive Bunny topped the charts, and our very own Simon Bates travelled around the world live on Radio 1.
Strap yourself in as Andy takes you back to late 80s teatime on BBC1 - Blue Peter, Grange Hill & Neighbours - plus 30 of the very best feel-good chart bangers from that era!
A whole evening of the ultimate in 80s singalongs! #NOW80s

programmes.show_name: Is This Really How They Started?
programmes.show_description: Most went on to much bigger things - but how did it all start? Here are 25 chart and video debuts from household names - some songs are brilliant, but some you might not know!
A whole evening of the ultimate in 80s singalongs! #NOW80s
Brother Beyond's lead singer Nathan Moore presents the 25 ultimate man-bands and boy-bands of the 80s! From The Jacksons and Johnny Hates Jazz to Bros and Big Fun.
Rick's here, not just with Stock, Aitken & Waterman's big stars like Kylie and Jason, but with other massive '80s bangers that influenced the brilliant Hit Factory sound. Jump in!
Trying to impress someone with your cool moves? Give these a go, as we party into the night on NOW 80s.
You may remember the artists, but do you recall their lesser heard songs? With Style Council, Boy George, Chris Rea, Billy Idol & Squeeze.
Sixty minutes of power pop and rock! Earplugs at the ready as we rewind to 1987 with GN'R, Aerosmith, Duran Duran, Cher, T'Pau and Whitesnake!
You may remember the artists, but do you recall their lesser heard songs? With Style Council, Boy George, Chris Rea, Billy Idol & Squeeze.
8 electrifying hours of power pop & rock legends! Every track's a banger, guaranteed to rock your socks off - if your speakers had muscles, this is what they would play!
The timeless songs from Bonnie's power period - 1976 to 1985. Includes 'Total Eclipse'!
From the decade that invented the genre - non-stop powerful love songs, back to back.

programmes.show_name: I Want My Music TV! Top 50
programmes.show_description: Music TV continues with Bonnie Tyler, Sister Sledge & Madonna, through to million-selling hits from Frankie, Wham! & Soft Cell. These are the official biggest of the 80s!

programmes.show_name: The 80s Are Best: Forget the Rest!
programmes.show_description: All '80s, 24/7 - the feelgood pop decade where the Brits invaded the world!

programmes.show_name: Make Mine A Double with Pat Sharp!
programmes.show_description: They say 2 heads are better than one & in the 80s the charts were full of collaborations. So pour a large one & have double the fun with Pat Sharp's top 40 duets.
